author: Jason Corwin
comment: Does not seem to work with Huawei watch. Seems to set random brightness values without any rhyme or reason. Think this could be a good app if it had some simplified settings. Not sure how many users need different brightness levels for biking vs driving. Would be better if user could manually set brightness by hours/time (ie brightness level 1 from 9pm to 6am).
title: Does not work

author: Connor Rhodes
comment: This app is incredibly simple and allows me to actually see my wash screen in daylight. For some reason, my Asus Zenwatch constantly readjusts to low brightness leaving me unable to view the screen anywhere but indoors. This app keeps the brightness high when is the text that I am driving walking etc. The activity detection is very accurate in my experience. can set it anywhere from low to high depending on what you are doing and it will seamlessly change the brightness settings.
title: Does exactly what it should

author: Tony Simmons
comment: An option to work with watches with an "auto" mode would be nice. For example, set the brightness to adjust automatically during the day, then switch to lowest at night. My Moto 360v1is annoyingly bright when it happens to come on while I'm driving at night, even when it's set to auto brightness.

author: Erik Strack
comment: Necessary for all Android Wear 2.0 watches without an ambient light sensor!  Will save me from too-bright eye strain at night, and allow me to use my watch outside during the day, since Google removed the "brightness boost" feature in Android Wear 2.0, rendering my watch basically useless. Google and Asus should refer people to this app, before they return their Android Wear 2.0 watches which don't include an ambient-light sensor.  Their products make no sense without this.

author: Mauro Cattaneo
comment: I love this app! Unfortunately I'm having some problem to use it since my LG Urbane 2nd switched to AW2. Is there a way to use it with Android Wear 2.0?

author: Chris VonArb
comment: Works well at detecting when I'm driving.  A life saver for setting the watch bright enough to actually read while out and then drop it back down while at work.   The gear live lacks any light sensor so this is almost a required app for that device.  It's pretty accurate about finding sunrise/set time for wherever your phone is on the globe, set different levels for day/night to each activity.  Profiles that are geofenced instead of activity based as well would be a welcome update.
title: Galaxy Gear Live  (1st gen wear)

author: Mike Colmo
comment: Would be nice to have some control over when daytime/nighttime begins
title: Time based brightness?

author: Caleb Schlossin
comment: I wish it was a bit more configurable or allowed for tie in with Tasker. I've been using this app on Huawei Watch and I really like it. I'm hoping there will be additional development and new features moving forward.

comment: Doesn't work on my GWR. Edit: Hasn't been updated in 6 months despite it not working.

comment: Does what it supposed to and well. Huawei watch 1.
I have noticed a lot of reviews complaining that the app doesn't do anything... the app description says that you must restart your phone if it doesn't work.  I am loving this app.
title: Restart your watch for it to begin working

author: Ken Weise
comment: Great idea. Crap implementation. It comes with a list of activities. Want to add your own? Too bad. Want to delete one? To bad. You get what's on the list.  The description mentions using your coarse location for sunrise/sunset. There is no way to do this. The menu button does nothing. Long press brings up the brightness for the pre defined list.   Uninstalled.
title: I want it, but it is too limited

comment: With the "Always on" setting my ambient brightness setting is noticeable brighter than the normal mode. It should always be less. If this is added in the settings then this app gets 5 stars!

author: Ryan Reese
comment: I'm glad someone did this, I've been wishing for a time-based automatic brightness adjustment for my G Watch since day one.  However, I think there can be improvements made to it.  As it is now, there is absolutely no indication that the app is active or doing anything and there are no settings or variables for users to configure.  I think that there should be settings (either on watch of phone) where people can manually specify what brightness they want at what hours, as well as an option to enable/disable
title: Is this even doing anything?  Good idea, needs an interface

author: Marc Lee
comment: Now just needs some customisation options. For example a global on/off setting (for when user wants manual control again), and custom brightness levels per "state" (since each person has different preferences). Lots of potential here though.
title: Great concept...

comment: Recommend more ways to configure brightness. Time of  day for example you know you are at work 8AM - 4Pm, and you know what brightness would be ideal at work.  Mon-Fri 8am - 4pm brightness = 3  Excellent though, and it is so far free, can not complain
